short_summary: Risk Management Specialist Services: 37 Grants and Contributions Programs
description: Independent Program Level Risk Assessment for 37 Gs&Cs Programs, supporting the departmental priority of strengthening risk management processes
full_summary: # Government Tender Announcement ## Title The Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) is seeking a contractor to perform independent Program Level Risk Assessment for 37 Grants and Contributions (Gs&Cs) Programs. ## Solicitation Information * **Reference Number**: PW-22-01010392 * **Amendment Number**: 1 * **Solicitation Number**: 100020588 * **Publication Date**: October 19, 2022 * **Tender Closing Date**: November 14, 2022 (14:00:00) * **Amendment Date**: November 1, 2022 ## Contract Details * **Expected Contract Start Date**: None * **Expected Contract End Date**: None * **Duration**: Proposed period of contract shall be from Contract Award for 24 months. ## Solicitation Summary Upon review of the Treasury Board Secretariat Policy and Directive on Transfer Payments, as well as audit recommendations and consultant reports, ESDC requires a contractor to perform an independent program level risk assessment for 37 Grants and Contributions (Gs&Cs) Programs. This assessment will enable the department to strengthen risk management processes, respond to emerging risks, and monitor the effectiveness of risk mitigation strategies. ## Requirements The contractor shall: 1. Perform an independent program level risk assessment for the Gs&Cs programs 2. Develop a risk management strategy to address identified risks 3. Develop recommendations for improving risk management processes 4. Submit a comprehensive report detailing the evaluation and recommendations ## Important Information This solicitation is open to contractors who are in compliance with the Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and other international trade agreements. The solicitation is available in both English and French. ## Contact Information For more information, please contact: * Gregory Molson, nc-solicitations-gd@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca Attachments: Solicitation Document (English)
